prompt: Evaluate database backup strategies for disaster recovery.

criteria.name: Understanding of Backup Strategies
criteria.description: Demonstrates knowledge of different database backup methods.

performance_descriptors.excellent: Clearly explains full, incremental, differential, and continuous backups with advantages and disadvantages.
performance_descriptors.good: Accurately describes at least two backup methods and their purposes.
performance_descriptors.average: Mentions backup strategies with basic explanation.
performance_descriptors.needs_improvement: Basic or unclear understanding of backup methods.

criteria.name: Disaster Recovery Application
criteria.description: Explains how backup strategies are used for disaster recovery.

performance_descriptors.excellent: Insightfully analyzes how each backup method contributes to fast and reliable disaster recovery.
performance_descriptors.good: Describes how backups help restore data after a disaster.
performance_descriptors.average: States backups are needed for recovery but with little detail.
performance_descriptors.needs_improvement: Minimal or unclear link to disaster recovery.

criteria.name: Use of Examples
criteria.description: Uses examples to illustrate backup and recovery in real scenarios.

performance_descriptors.excellent: Multiple, relevant examples with clear explanations.
performance_descriptors.good: At least one clear example provided.
performance_descriptors.average: Example is vague or minimally described.

criteria.name: Structure and Academic Style
criteria.description: Presents answer in a logical, academic style.

performance_descriptors.excellent: Highly organized, formal, and clear response.
performance_descriptors.good: Clear structure and mostly formal style.

key_points: Explains full, incremental, differential, and continuous backups
Discusses pros and cons for each method
Links backup strategies to disaster recovery (speed, reliability, recovery point)
llm_questions: What are the main types of database backups?
How do full, incremental, and differential backups work?
Why are backup strategies important for disaster recovery?
Can you give real examples of backup strategies in organizations?
What factors affect the choice of backup method?
